shortdesc.ph: Used to set the sound insulation zone.

plentry.pd: Spatial center point of the soundproof zone. This parameter is an array of length 3, with the three values representing the front, right, and up coordinates respectively.
Forward unit vector starting from position. This parameter is an array of length 3, with the three values representing the front, right, and up coordinates respectively.
Right unit vector starting from position. This parameter is an array of length 3, with the three values representing the front, right, and up coordinates respectively.
Upward unit vector starting from position. This parameter is an array of length 3, with the three values representing the front, right, and up coordinates respectively.
Treating the entire soundproof zone as a cube, this parameter represents the length of the forward edge, in units of the game engine.
Treating the entire soundproof zone as a cube, this parameter represents the length of the right edge, in units of the game engine.
Treating the entire soundproof zone as a cube, this parameter represents the length of the upward edge, in units of the game engine.

Sound attenuation coefficient when users inside the soundproof zone communicate with users outside. Value range is [0, 1]. Specific values:
0: Broadcast mode, volume and timbre do not attenuate with distance; local users hear consistent volume and timbre regardless of distance.
(0, 0.5): Weak attenuation mode, where volume and timbre attenuate slightly during propagation, and sound travels farther than in real environments.
0.5: Simulates volume attenuation in real environments, equivalent to not setting the audioAttenuation parameter.
(0.5, 1]: Strong attenuation mode (default is 1), where volume and timbre attenuate rapidly during propagation.
ID of the sound insulation zone.
Center point of the sound insulation zone. This parameter is an array of length 3, with the three values representing coordinates in the forward, right, and up directions respectively.
Forward unit vector from position. This parameter is an array of length 3, with the three values representing coordinates in the forward, right, and up directions respectively.
Right unit vector from position. This parameter is an array of length 3, with the three values representing coordinates in the forward, right, and up directions respectively.
Up unit vector from position. This parameter is an array of length 3, with the three values representing coordinates in the forward, right, and up directions respectively.
Treat the entire sound insulation zone as a cube. This parameter represents the edge length in the forward direction, in the unit length of the game engine.
Treat the entire sound insulation zone as a cube. This parameter represents the edge length in the right direction, in the unit length of the game engine.
Treat the entire sound insulation zone as a cube. This parameter represents the edge length in the up direction, in the unit length of the game engine.

Audio attenuation coefficient when users inside the sound insulation zone communicate with users outside. Value range: [0, 1]. Value details:
0: Broadcast mode. Volume and tone do not attenuate with distance. Sound is consistent at near and far distances.
(0, 0.5): Weak attenuation mode. Volume and tone slightly attenuate during transmission. Sound travels farther than in real environments.
0.5: (Default) Simulates real-world volume attenuation.
(0.5, 1]: Strong attenuation mode. Volume and tone attenuate quickly during transmission.
